tasks.text: Confirm Supplier Master Agreement is in place before work begins.
Verify access to Walmart Web Portal, ST Technical Document Center, and Security Technology Projects site.
Download and have onsite: device location drawings, wiring details, cable assignment sheet, and BOM for this project.
Confirm all required state/local licenses & permits are valid and available for review (AHJ & Security Manager).
Verify all onsite personnel have OSHA-10 and onsite supervisor has OSHA-30; carry cards onsite.
Assign a project representative (manager) as the single point of contact with Security Manager & project team.
After pre-possession meeting: send Authorized Employee List + licenses + OSHA cards to GC, Store Planner, and Security Manager; upload to Portal.
Within 5 days of project start, complete Walmart Project Timeline/Gantt form and send to Security Manager + upload to Portal.
Plan work so substantial completion is 14 days before GO, with AHJ inspections completed 7 days before GO.
Send weekly update email (one per project) to Security Manager and upload to Portal by Thursday 5 PM.
Immediately communicate any issues that could impact progress or completion date in the weekly update.
Ensure weekly update form is complete and accurate if requesting 50% progress payment at ~60% install completion.
Meet with GC to review Walmart/site-specific safety requirements before starting work; follow GC safety program.
Provide spotters for lifts and ensure all personnel wear required PPE (vest, hard hat, etc.) at all times.
Ensure all techs wear company photo ID and project badge visibly on outer garment while onsite.
Attend daily morning GC/store planning meetings or check-in call when offsite.
Do not use Walmart ladders, lifts, shopping carts, or other store property for installation work.
Keep work areas clean and free of debris; clean each workspace and lift/container area daily.
Document and repair any damage caused by installation (walls, paint, ceilings, etc.) as required.
Perform pre-inspection of existing CCTV/alarm system (photos + quick test) before starting work; upload to Portal within 7 days.
Plan demolition of unused system components per drawings; remove unused cameras, racks, and head-end gear.
Be prepared to replace ceiling tiles in pharmacy, service desk, front registers for drop ceiling stores as required.
If building exterior is painted, clean and readjust exterior cameras as needed.
Box or palletize unused equipment and complete ST Used Assets Return Manifest for claims associate.
Install cable with proper supports (bridle rings/J-hooks/grid wire) and maintain required clearances from roof deck and ceilings.
Keep fire, data, CCTV and other systems in separate conduits/trays/supports; no shared pathways.
Provide low-voltage conduits where needed, deburred with bushings; seal cooler/freezer/exterior conduits with proper rated sealant.
Provide 20 ft service loops for UTP at device, neat 6" coil; limit alarm device loops to 1 ft max.
Keep UTP runs ≤ 90 m (permanent link) and ≤ 100 m including patch cords; keep alarm circuits within 80% of rated length/load.
Use Cat5e or better for CCTV and 18 AWG minimum for alarm; avoid T-taps on alarm circuits.
Label both ends of each cable with machine-printed, self-laminating labels (e.g., CCTV-01-GM, device/loop IDs for alarm).
Route all head-end cabling through wire management or conduit, Velcro for UTP, neatly dressed and protected from damage.
Take screenshots of all existing cameras before work; upload PDF to Portal within 7 days.
Maintain Master Cable Assignment Sheet with switch/port/device/IP/MAC and keep updated in DVRPC C:\data folder.
Terminate all camera UTP to patch panels and use yellow patch cords to switches; no direct-to-switch terminations.
Coordinate port programming with Wachter NOC via email; plan to minimize number of contacts.
Mount exterior fixed cameras so lens is 12.5 ft AFF; follow conduit and sealing requirements for exterior boxes.
Mount vestibule cameras at 6 ft AFF (unless approved otherwise), with ½" EMT to accessible space and distances from glass (18" side, 24" top).
Mount PTZs at bottom of bar joist height with appropriate Unistrut/pendant hardware and verify FOV and control.
Install Missed Scan cameras centered on POS glass, mounted to stable structure, and submit IP map + FOV screenshots (4 per page) within 5 days of final register layout.
Install pendant PVMs with secure attachment to bar joists and correct power/decoder connections.
Install wall PVMs with mounts and HDMI/decoder connections per drawings.
Ensure lowest point of all monitors is 8 ft AFF (10 ft for Sam’s Clubs).
Program cameras into Verint (or March, if applicable) per CSV/cable assignment sheet and Walmart VMS guides.
Install DVRPC in AP or UPC office in week 1, run full install script before power-down, and connect all monitors/printers properly.
Verify every camera is online, properly named, focused, and recording before final punch with Security Manager.
Capture and save FOV screenshots for each camera in required PDF layout (including POS and Missed Scan maps).
Take photos of front and back of each IDF/TC rack showing neat cabling and labeling.
Build and leave CCTV Service Binder in AP office with manuals, redline as-builts, Master Cable Assignment, and checklists.
Run a minimum 48-hour endurance test on the CCTV system and correct any issues before final acceptance.
Provide CCTV operator training for onsite staff (up to 2 sessions, 2 hrs each, normal business hours).
Perform visual and functional pre-inspection of alarm system (RTUs, faults, supervisory signals) and report non-operable points within 5 days.
Always place alarm system on test via VRT/management/Alarm Central before work begins and notify store management.
Remove system from test before leaving each day; verify normal status on keypads and notification circuits.
Do not strap out points to force normal; have Alarm Central D-pop points that will remain abnormal, track all ticket numbers.
Install or extend fire alarm backboard (fire-rated, painted) and gutters per proto layouts and scope for this store type.
Perform stand-alone battery test as part of final 48-hour alarm system test.
Create separate fire and intrusion as-builts with wiring paths, splices, devices, and all deviations from prints.
Obtain and file closed permits, AHJ sign-off documents, and any required state/jurisdiction tags or certifications.
Send and document test signals from Alarm Central showing each point tested; ensure no missing or grouped points.
Install framed alarm zone map at main keypad/annunciator, updated to match as-builts and code; remove intrusion maps if present.
Place binder in panel document enclosure with all alarm close-out docs, stamped prints, as-builts, manuals, and checklists.
Provide alarm system training to store management per Walmart alarm training guide, with at least two sessions if needed.
Inventory all received equipment against POD, BOM, and prints within 48 hours; upload POD and inventory to Portal within 5 days.
Provide secure storage (no Walmart interior storage) and protect all equipment from weather/theft; confirm pallet count vs container size.
Review excess equipment with Security Manager and arrange returns via STAR or vendor RMA as required.
Report any equipment loss/damage to Security Manager; understand replacement costs may be deducted from payment.
Ensure storage containers and equipment are removed from site at least one week prior to grand opening.
